headline: CNN This Morning
subHeadline: EPA Administrator Says Government Will Remain in East Palestine, Ohio, to Help Recovery from Chemical Spill Caused by Train Derailment; Five Former Memphis Police Officers to Appear in Court to Face Charges of Murder in Death of Tyre Nichols; Former NBA Players Kenny Smith, Charles Barkley, and Shaquille O'Neal Discuss Working Together as Sports Analysts; "Inside The NBA" Team Joins CNN This Morning At All-Star Weekend; Biden: Latest Downed Objects Likely Unrelated To Chinese Spying. Aired 8-8:30a ET

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Back into town until all of this was done. You don't bring families back with their kids and their loved ones and then tell them to scrub with Dawn.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: It's a concern being echoed by so many. Right now, officials estimate that thousands of fish were killed by contamination that was washing down streams and rivers. Ohio Senator J.D. Vance was there to see it firsthand. Here is what his assessment was.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) SEN. J.D. VANCE, (R-OH):  Something I just discovered is that if you scrape the creek bed, it's like chemical is coming out of the ground. Could we show it? Can you come here, and let me just show this to people. I'm looking at the camera, but watch this. Just see that chemical pop out of the creek. This is disgusting. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: That's what the senator is saying. Also this morning we are seeing new surveillance video that shows sparks flying from the train less than an hour before it crashed. This is important because it could give investigators key clues about what happened, what led to that. This is in Alliance, Ohio. You can see the train. It's right there on the right hand of your screen. It's 57 minutes before it crashed. You don't see any sparks there. But the train keeps going, keeps going down the tracks. By 8Another surveillance camera here, same time, same town, the train keeps going for 20 miles after that headed for East Palestine. That is where it derailed at 8:55 p.m., a full 43 minutes after we first saw though sparks in Salem. CNN's Jason Carroll is live on the ground where he has been in East Palestine. Jason, this is going to be a cause for concern. I know the NTSB is paying close attention to all of those different clips of those surveillance videos. What are you hearing?

utterances.speaker: JASON CARROLL, CNN NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Well, this is clearly going to be, Kaitlan, as you point out, a key part, a significant part of this investigation. According to the NTSB, that surveillance video that you mentioned there shows a wheel bearing, quote, in the final stage of overheat failure moments before the derailment. Again, this according to the NTSB.The wheel bearing is the part, of course, that connects the wheel to the axle. So what's going to happen now is these parts have been isolated. They are going to be taken to Washington, D.C., so experts there can evaluate exactly what happened there with those key parts. All of this happening, though, here on the ground as people continue to worry about their health, their safety, the air, the water. I spoke to the head of the EPA yesterday about all this to get his assessment of what is happening here on the ground. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: You've heard some of the stories that are coming in, people talking about having rashes, their pets getting sick, things like that.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL REGAN, EPA ADMINISTRATOR
utterances.sentences: What I would say is if anyone is experiencing any kind of adverse symptom, have their pets go to the veterinarian. They should seek medical attention. We need for this information to get to the state health department so that we can coordinate and be sure that people are getting the help that they need.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: Can you help us clear up what specifically you are testing for? Is it just for vinyl chloride?

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.sentences: We are testing for the full breadth of toxic chemicals that were on that train that was spilled. We have the capabilities to detect every single adverse impact that would result from that spill, and that's what we're doing. We will be here for as long as it takes to see this process through. I want to assure the people --

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: I just want to say, when you say as long as it takes, I think the question is, long term, is someone going to be here a year from now, two years from now to come back, test the water, test the soil?

utterances.speaker: REGAN
utterances.sentences: I am very clear when I say as long as it takes. We will go through this process with the citizens of East Palestine for as long as it takes. The federal government will be here for as long as it takes.(END VIDEO CLIP) CARROLL:  In terms of the federal response, Ohio's governor, Kaitlan, has also said it's now time for the CDC to get some of their experts here on the ground to evaluate people who say they are now experiencing symptoms. Kaitlan?

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely. They want to know why they are having those symptoms. Jason Carroll, thank you.Also this morning, police in Los Angeles are investigating two shootings in a Jewish community as a possible hate crime. The Pico- Robertson neighborhood is on edge after two Jewish people who were walking home from their synagogues were shot. Police arrested a suspect, say they are going to be ramping up patrols in the area. Surveillance video shows the victim from the second incident moments after the shooting, as you can see here. Both victims are hospitalized and in stable condition this morning. We'll continue to follow that.

utterances.speaker: STEVE MULROY, SHELBY COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: That's not the kind of thing that I can talk about right now. We have an ongoing investigation and an ongoing prosecution. But what I can say is we are looking at everybody who was involved directly or indirect in the death of Tyre Nichols, and that includes Officer Hemphill. It include people who showed up after the beating had concluded. But we are --

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Right, we've heard about sheriff's deputies, members of the Memphis Fire Department who have been fired or disciplined. So it sounds like they are under review as well?

utterances.speaker: MULROY
utterances.sentences: Correct. That is correct. And we are going to do what we can as quickly as I can, but thoroughly. And we will be making decisions about charges regarding all those people in the time ahead.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: It's rare for police officers involved in killings to be charged, much less indicted or convicted. Can you talk about some of the challenges in this particular case, because you are seeking a lot of these are second-degree murder charges, right? What are the challenges for you specifically?

utterances.speaker: MULROY
utterances.sentences: Well, in Tennessee second-degree murder requires proof that the defendants knowingly killed Tyre Nichols, which under Tennessee law means that they acted in such a way that they were reasonably certain that their actions could cause death. In any case where you have a police officer as defendants, of course, there is challenges if jurors are inclined to credit police officer testimony more than the average witness.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Believe they feared for their lives, et cetera.

utterances.speaker: MULROY
utterances.sentences: Et cetera, yes. And that's always the case. But we believe we have a strong case. We believe we've charged appropriately and we will be able to prove every element of the offense from second-degree murder all the way down to all the other charges beyond a reasonable doubt.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: We have also been hearing that there are now defense attorneys in the county who want to review any cases touched by the SCORPION unit. We're talking hundreds of arrests. What concerns do you have that some of your cases will be overturned as a result of all of this?

utterances.speaker: MULROY
utterances.sentences: Well, it is a concern. And what we have decided to do is we are proactively reviewing every case involving those six officers we just got done discussing. And we'll also take a look at any other case that a defense attorney will bring to us if they have some credible reason for thinking that the case might be suspect. I have a concern as a district attorney about manpower issues because that is going to be a time-consuming process, and I've got a lot of other cases that we need, of course, to prosecute. And then there is the chance that some non-trivial number of cases will eventually be overturned.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: That's the Shelby County District Attorney Steve Mulroy. Thank you so much for speaking with us.

utterances.speaker: MULROY
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: And we'll be right back.(COMMERCIAL BREAK) (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: End it Shaq. Get in!(CHEERS)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And what that means is Kenny and Chuck need to take peanut butter to the face.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. You playing games.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You playing games.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I bet you $20 I'll bite the chip and won't even make a face.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Without making a face?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We're making sci-fi until we die. This is nothing to me.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm not making a face.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, you are!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Don't cheat, Chuck! Don't cheat.(LAUGHTER)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That was bad right there.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: A moment we'll never forget, that was Shaquille O'Neal flying into a Christmas tree. You get sharp analysis, so much more, including flying into Christmas trees, from TNT's "Inside the NBA." They are here in Salt Lake City for NBA All-Star weekend. The All-Star game is Sunday night right on our sister network, TNT. I sat down with three of them, Shaq, Charles Barkley, and Kenny Smith, and, you know, just watch. It was a delight.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: This is so fun for me.CHARLES BARKLEY, ANALYST, "NBA ON TNT":  Well, it's also for us.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I never -- usually it's like senators --SHAQUILLE O'NEAL, ANALYST, "NBA ON TNT":  One, two, three, back to one. KENNY SMITH, ANALYST, "NBA ON TNT":  She was talking to me. O'NEAL:  No, she was talking to Kenny first.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: She made eye contact.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you're in the middle, so.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: She looked straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Well, we go way back. So I am just getting to know you.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, when you ask a question or something, you have to say our name.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes, I will.O'NEAL:  Because he always tries to be the first, the middle, and the last answer.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Stepping on your toes too much?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Then he'll say, I am not going to speak for Kenny, but -- I am not going to speak for Shaq but --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: But I really am.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: But he is speaking for us.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: See what I have to deal with?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: OK, we are starting with you.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Sir Charles, are you looking forward most to Shaq deejaying this weekend?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He is a great deejay. I've got to give him credit. He travels the country every weekend doing the deejay thing. He practices at work. You know, when we should be watching the game, he practices at work. But I hear --O'NEAL:  Is this a clone? (LAUGHTER) O'NEAL:  Is that really him? Charles Barkley gave me a compliment?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But here's a really talented deejay.O'NEAL:  Charles, Charles, where are you?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He can pay me later.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: He doesn't really think it's you.We've got to start with the debate over the GOAT, because it was your interview with LeBron pretty recently where you got him to admit that he thought he was, is the GOAT. What do you think? O'NEAL:  Many different answers, Jordan and LeBron. The only thing that saddens me about it is you kind of forget about my young fellow, Mr. Kobe Bryant. But listen, Lebron's had a great career. Michael has had a great career. For me it's just great barbershop talk. I actually see people in the barbershop getting ready over to fight over this. No, no, this, this.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: About who is the GOAT.O'NEAL:  Yes, who is the GOAT.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You don't think it's LeBron?

utterances.speaker: KENNY SMITH, ANALYST, NBA ON TNT
utterances.sentences: I don't play against LeBron. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: So, that's why I think like, it's not fair. Why should do generational?

utterances.speaker: POPPY HARLOW, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I want to talk about the show because you guys have this and obviously, we're missing, you know, before the other great --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: The Godfather.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- the Godfather, Ernie. But you have something special and magical. And the chemistry is just -- it made it -- it's nearly impossible to have chemistry like you guys do. And Kenny, you said in an interview recently -- you said the one thing I've learned is that being on a championship team, is it everyone's role is really valuable. Why does this work so well? What is it?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I think everyone's role is really valuable. When you make a great cake and you just say I'm going to just eat frosting, it's not going to take you. If I have cake, it's not going to be if you'd have -- don't have the sprinkles that don't look the same.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Who is the sprinkles?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You know I think we all have different components. I'll probably have a little bit more of the batter part.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You're the batter?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I'm the batter.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What's Chuck?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Oh, Chuck is the cake.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: What's Shaq?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Oh, he's the frosting. He puts it all. He -- like we were great -- a great show. We were a great show. We were the best --SHAQUILLE O'NEAL, ANALYST, NBA ON TNT: It started off slow but it's getting good.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Well, good.O'NEAL: And we could keep going -- keep going.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: We are the best show I thought in television before he got here. But what he did, he cemented us is that.O'NEAL: We realize if we're going to keep you up at 12, one, 2:00 a.m., we want to make you laugh before you have to go to sleep. And you know as a fan that we have G14 classification to talk about all the things happening with the game.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I do.O'NEAL: Championship, one of the greatest players, Hall of Famer, made to the finals once but you know, that doesn't define him. He's still one of the greatest players --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: MVP.O'NEAL: -- MVP. You know you all know what I've done. So, you know that in certain situations we know. So, you know that we have mostly 99 percent of the answers. I am --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: How do you think it works?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm just -- I think we work because I'm just -- I'm the best- looking one out of the four. Kind of -- kind of by --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I knew you're going to say something like that.O'NEAL: Wrinkles.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hey, kind of by default because I'm working with three ugly people, so like I'm the best like one by default.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: But that's --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Probably, I think the key to also know you've been on television a long time, the people behind the scenes, we really just show up in act a fool on television, or at least actually the only one who actually works. Like Ernie goes in like noon, and we go on to seven, we show up at like 6O'NEAL: 6:50.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, 6O'NEAL: Yes, 6:50.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's right. SMITH

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I -- actually, like to get there at 6O'NEAL: It was traffic.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: -- just like with these two guys.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But the people behind the scenes -- I'd like to say, I give all the credit to Ernie and the people behind the scenes. We -- actually, if you play sports, the most of the fun -- the most fun thing in the world have been in the locker room, which is acting like we're in the locker room.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You're in the locker room on television?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's exactly what we are.O'NEAL: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, you said -- by the way, happy almost birthday.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Monday?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: The big 60?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I know.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Right?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm on a bag man.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And do you remember what you said?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'm looking at 60 as the end. You said that in 2018.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: The beginning of the end.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But getting off it is enough.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You said you want it --O'NEAL: No, he let me say the end.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- to have a good decade and have fun.O'NEAL: OK. And then -- and then -- and then he became Mr. $200 million man.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: That will do it.O'NEAL: They made him an offer he couldn't refuse.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: So, you're telling me you're not retiring on Monday?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No.O'NEAL: No.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: We're telling you -- we're telling you he can be bought.O'NEAL: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: He had to stay long.O'NEAL: Yes. 200 million.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No. So, obviously, 60 was my magic number to retire. But TNT came to me and they'd been great to me for 23 years. And I didn't want to say you own your own. I said -- and I said hey, you guys been great to me for 23 years, I'm not going because --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: They are calling you --O'NEAL: On today's -- on today's episode, he'll give the BS answer?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Poopy, it was --O'NEAL: Two --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It was --O'NEAL: 200 million, Poppy. That's what he was.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Poppy --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on. Look here --O'NEAL: Yes, two -- Poppy, Do you want a hundred?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Listen, Poppy, (INAUDIBLE)O'NEAL: 200.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: We want -- we want you to go to 60. Can you go to 70? Oh yes, I think I can.O'NEAL: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I think I can. There's a little engine that could.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Now, you know, first of all, I'm not going to stay to 70. I can promise you that.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, you want -- you've got ten years on.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I'm not going to stay to 70. But --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: But do you want to leave it on the table?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Because listen, they've been great to me.O'NEAL: (INAUDIBLE) (CROSSTALK) O'NEAL: That's you, right there.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Speaking of money --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: -- don't you owe him?O'NEAL: No, he owes me for the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, why do I owe you --O'NEAL: He just lost.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not talking about the Super Bowl. I know about the betting on the Super Bowl. I'm talking about spectacular.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I spell spectacular --O'NEAL: What's that?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, do you remember that now, spell spectacular?O'NEAL: No, you cheated.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No. how do I cheat?O'NEAL: Spell it right now.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do it.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Spell it right now.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I have to write it down

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do it. O'NEAL

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: S-P-E-C-T-A-L-U-R, is that right?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No.O'NEAL: Yes, that is right.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: OK. I have to write it down.O'NEAL: That's him.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You got it right --O'NEAL: Does he --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Is that -- is that going down?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And he -- and you, promising ten grand and did you --O'NEAL: If you're in the -- if you're in a spelling bee contest, you can write it down.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Put that mic --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: See, I don't --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I can't do that like I -- when I write --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Do you think --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: She is.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Did you pay up?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No, he did not.O'NEAL: No because he wrote it down. That's cheating.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's not cheating. We were on a spelling bee, where am I cheating?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It was -- world is that cheating.O'NEAL: Yes, in the spelling bee.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You can.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, you can write it down.O'NEAL: No, you can't write it down.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: This is the spelling --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You cannot write down in the spelling bee.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: This is --O'NEAL: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Do you want to see what I have to deal with?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, I live like five-minute walk from Barclays and love going to Nets games.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And then now, the Nets are a little bit of a different team. So, let's start with Kyrie going to the Mavs. Chuck, what do you -- what do you think about Kyrie because it wasn't just the Mavs who wanted him? I mean, several teams made major offers despite all the controversy around him for multiple things.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, the one negative thing about sports, if you got talent, you can get away with anything. You see it as long as I've been alive. And there's always a double standard. Great talents, whether you're in high school, college, or pros, you get away. It's a double standard. It's not right it's not wrong, that's just how it is.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Final question to Kenny because I learned that he is the only one of the three of you who actually did the slam dunk contest at All- Star.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He lost.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't --O'NEAL: This time you lost.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Didn't you lose?O'NEAL: He lost.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Time out.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He lost.O'NEAL: He lost.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Time out.O'NEAL: At the lowest three he lost.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Time out.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You lost.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Can I answer the question in?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: When you went to the NBA Finals, everybody else lost but you lost in the final. I was the second-best dunker --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- in the basketball history -- in basketball history, that is.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You Lost. You don't brag about losing.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I came in -- well, I actually got more credit for losing because everybody thought I won. Thank you very much --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: When he said everybody, he may --O'NEAL: Who?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: -- he thought he won.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, everyone. It was all over the media.O'NEAL: Yes, well --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: But I'll tell you -- let me give you another tidbit. I'm the only person in the history of basketball that's ever done the dunk contest --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: And the three point?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: -- on the same night.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, you lost both.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: On the same night.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You lost both.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Wait, but you know what? You get in.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You lost both.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No, there's other -- no, I didn't lose both.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Don't you remember? We have all.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: I was second in the world --O'NEAL: That's lost. SMITH: That's not losing. O'NEAL: Nobody bragged being a second.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Second in the world is like losing.O'NEAL: Nobody -- listen --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You know, Poppy --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Who's the second-best rapper in the world?

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Hey, Chuck --O'NEAL: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Isn't that not losing? We didn't lose to the Bulls. We were the second-best team.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: And you were.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That sound like a media at all.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No, you don't. you say I'm good.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Wait, we didn't lose to the Bulls. We were second.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Well, you lost to the Bulls.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We were the second --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You lost to the Bulls.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: It's different when he does it.O'NEAL: It does.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Yes, it does.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes. We -- how about -- I've been thinking about it wrong all these years. We didn't lose the championship.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You're the second best.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We're the second-best team. Thank you, Kenny.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Enlightening. Thank you for being --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Half full.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: S-P-E-C-T-A-C-U-L-A-R.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: U-L-A-A-R.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you probably went to class.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I hope I got it right.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You do --

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: No, you don't. That was spectacular.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, you're successful. You're doing good, Poppy.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: You are spectacular today.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I'm sure someone will tell me on Twitter.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) on social media.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.O'NEAL: What do people do when you walk in the bank?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, they better run to -- run to me. When it -- when I walk into the bank if that manager is sitting there when I get that man you better meet me at the door. He better say hey, Mr. Barkley, good to see you. If he sits in that seat, be gone.

utterances.speaker: SMITH
utterances.sentences: Hey, and that's the wrap.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Told you. Nothing off limits. That made my week. You can get Shaq, Charles, and Kenny all weekend on our sister network TNT for NBA's All-Star Weekend.Guys, tonight, you've got the rising stars game right behind me. Tomorrow, the league's biggest stars compete in the skills challenge and the three-point and the slam dunk contest. Finally, Sunday night for the first time ever, NBA All-Star captains will draft their teams right before the game. You're not going to want to miss it. That was just a delight, guys.

utterances.speaker: AUDIE CORNISH, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: That we went faster. Yes.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I don't know what to say.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Bring them back weekly --

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: I wrote (INAUDIBLE) quotes. Love it.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes. There was spelling, there was Christmas trees, it was a lot.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh, Poppy --

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Did I --

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: -- that was so amazing.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: I want to go to the bank with -- I want to go -- I mean when he -- like -- what -- I just want to go to the bank with Charles Barkley and watch everyone get up when he wanted.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I just want his checks, really. But also, that sounds good -- that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: I love what he said. We never lost we were just in the second place.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Sounds great.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Well, happy early birthday to Charles Barkley.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Poppy, that was -- that literally just paid the whole morning.

utterances.speaker: CORNISH
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: That was so good.

utterances.speaker: HARLOW
utterances.sentences: Good. It's good to all see you guys, in a little --

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: Republicans and some Democrats are demanding more answers from President Biden about that recent string of mysterious objects floating over North America. The president is promising new action to improve America's aerial defenses after multiple objects were shot down, including what the administration says with this Chinese spy balloon.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: I've directed my team to come back to me with sharper rules for how we will deal with these unidentified objects moving forward, distinguishing between those that are likely to pose safety and security risks that necessitate action and those that do not. I'll be sharing with Congress these classified policy parameters when they're completed, and they'll remain classified so we don't give our roadmap to our enemies to try to evade our defenses.(END VIDEO CLIP)
